English: Shit... What came over me back there...?
Chinese: 可惡……我明明不打算說那種話的……
Korean: 제길…… 그런 말을 할 생각은 없었는데……
German: Mist ... Was ist denn da in mich gefahren?

English:
Don't worry about it...
Nothing else you could've done.
Chinese:
別在意了……
這也沒辦法啊。
Korean:
신경 쓰지 마…
어쩔 수 없었어
German:
Mach dir keine Gedanken ...
Du hättest nichts weiter tun können.

English: But I mean, he stuck up for me and everything...
Chinese: 可是，難得他又來保護我了……
Korean: 하지만, 모처럼 그 녀석이 날 감싸주었는데……
German: Aber er hat sich für mich eingesetzt und so ...

English:
I'm sure he's not upset. That's the kind of guy
he is, right?
Chinese:
他一定不會在意的，
他就是這種人對吧？
Korean:
분명히 신경도 안 쓸걸.
그런 녀석이지? 그 녀석은
German:
Er nimmt es dir sicher nicht übel.
So ist er schließlich, nicht wahr?

English: Ah, so you're angry at yourself?
Chinese: ……哦，這樣啊。在意的人，是你才對啊。
Korean: ……아아, 그런가. 신경쓰고 있는 건 네 쪽인가
German: Ach, du bist also wütend auf dich?

English:
You're frustrated that you're still the same weak
kid, even in high school? And he's still helping
you out, just like when you were little.
Chinese:
就算到了高中，被他看到你還是一樣軟弱，
讓你很不甘心對吧？而且，“又一次”
被他救了呢，就跟小時候一樣……
Korean:
고등학교에 들어가서도 여전히 약한 자신을 보인 게 분한 거지?
게다가 "또" 꼬맹이 시절처럼 그 녀석에게 도움을 받아버려서……
German:
Du bist frustriert, dass du immer noch so klein
und schwach bist, wie in der Schule? Und er
hilft dir immer noch, wie damals.

English:
Sissy boy! Sissy boy! Don't like me calling you
that? Why don't you stop me?!
Chinese:
喂～娘娘腔──！　羞羞臉──！
不甘心的話就來打我啊──！
Korean:
야이~ 남자여자! 여자남자!
분하면 받아쳐 보시지!
German:
Weichei! Weichei! Ich soll dich nicht so nennen?
Halt mich doch davon ab!

English: No way! Yu's too much of a sissy!
Chinese:
他做不到啦！
人家是“小優優”耶！
Korean:
당연히 못하겠지~!
"유우 양"인걸~!
German: Pustekuchen! Yu ist halt ein Weichei!

English:
You just gonna cry and let him help you again?
Pathetic!
Chinese:
又要哭了，是想要他來幫你喔──
真沒用！
Korean:
또 울면서 그 녀석한테 도와달라고 할 거냐~
한심하네~!
German:
Du heulst nur und lässt ihn wieder helfen?
Wie armselig!

English:
No! I'm not like that anymore!
I don't need his help anymore!
Chinese:
不對……！　我……我跟那時候不一樣了……！
我不會再要他來幫忙……不會再要他來……！
Korean:
달라…! 나는… 그 무렵과는 달라…!
그 녀석에게 도움을 받던 내가 아냐… 내가 아냐…!
German:
Nein! So bin ich nicht mehr!
Ich brauche seine Hilfe nicht mehr!

English: Correct. I'm with you now.
Chinese:
……沒錯，
你已經有我跟著了。
Korean:
……그래.
너에게는 이제 내가 붙어있어
German: Richtig. Jetzt hast du mich.

English:
I'm on your side. Everything was great when you
did as I said, right?
Chinese:
我是你的夥伴。
我不是說過，只要照我說的做，
一切都會很順利啊？
Korean:
나는 네 편이다.
내가 말한 대로 했더니 전부 잘 풀렸잖아?
German:
Ich stehe hinter dir. Alles war toll, als du auf
mich gehört hast, nicht wahr?

English:
He started relying on you after his account was
stolen. It was your turn to help him.
Chinese:
因為帳號被奪走，他開始依賴你了，
這是你第一次變成幫助他的一方。
Korean:
계정을 빼앗긴 탓에 녀석은 너를 의지하기 시작했다.
처음으로 네가 녀석을 돕는 쪽에 서게 된 거야
German:
Er hat sich auf dich verlassen, nachdem sein
Account gestohlen wurde. Du warst dran,
ihm zu helfen.

English: You're not weak anymore.
Chinese: 你已經不是那個軟弱無力的你了。
Korean: 이제 너는 허약하던 네가 아니야…
German: Du bist nicht mehr schwach.

English:
But it's not enough, is it? People can still see
your weakness, can't they?
Chinese:
但是……還不夠對吧？
你又被他看到無力的一面了對吧？
Korean:
하지만…… 부족하지?
아직 약한 모습을 보이고 마는 거지?
German:
Aber es ist nicht genug, oder? Die Leute können
deine Schwäche noch immer sehen, nicht wahr?

English:
To them, you're still that weak little kid who got
picked on.
Chinese:
在他的心目中，你依然是那個弱小，
整天被人欺負的"小優優"……
Korean:
그 녀석 속에서 너는 아직 약하고
괴롭힘 당하는 "유우 양"인 그대로다……
German:
Für sie bist du immer noch der kleine Schwächling,
der gehänselt wurde.

English: I...I don't want that.
Chinese: 不、不要……
Korean: 시, 싫어…
German: Das ... Das will ich nicht.

English: You're right not to want that.
Chinese: 我不要，那樣……
Korean: 그런 건 싫어…
German: Aber natürlich willst du das nicht.

English: I understand, but you have to say what you want.
Chinese:
我懂……
……那麼，你得說出你到底想要什麼。
Korean:
알아….
……그렇다면 원하는 걸 원한다고 말해야겠지
German:
Ich verstehe es, aber du musst sagen, was du
willst.

English: Tell me your wish. I'll make it come true.
Chinese:
你想要的是什麼……？
我會為你實現那個願望……
Korean:
네가 원하는 게 뭐지…?
내가 그걸 이루어주지…
German:
Sag mir, was du dir wünschst. Ich werde dafür
sorgen, dass es in Erfüllung geht.

Korean: 난…
German: Ich ...

English: I want...
Chinese: 我……想要的是……
Korean: 내가… 원하는 건…
German: Ich will ...
